title: If I put copyrighted music in a video I made and only use it for personal use, can I distribute it to a few friends legally? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: If you want to distribute to friends, it sounds like its not just for personal use. If its truly personal use, go for it, just don’t upload it someplace online where people can view it. Be safe if you do put it online. Either purchase a license to use the music legally, or use some of the royalty-free music - there’s a lot of good sites out there with quality music. Just be sure you’re using the music as described and intended.

You can use it for your personal use (that can be with your friends/family in private space) But your friends can not take it out and expose it to the public, if they did, you do you would be on the hook for that. It would/might be considered bootlegging. I personally would not distribute it… I might show them - but I would not ever make copies of it let alone distribute them. tack care…
